title: Kentucky Pecan Pie Recipe
description: Corn syrup and brown sugar do magical things in this simple pecan pie with a rich, gooey, and delicious filling. Perfect for holiday bake sales.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Pies Pecan Pie Recipes Kentucky Pecan Pie 4.6 (273) 225 Reviews 42 Photos This pecan pie is a family favorite. I get many requests to make this for our church bake sales. Submitted by Laurie Nanni Updated on January 29, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 42 42 42 42 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 50 mins Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 9-inch pie Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 cup white corn syrup 1 cup packed brown sugar ⅓ teaspoon salt ⅓ cup unsalted butter, melted 3 large eggs, slightly beaten 1 cup chopped pecans 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Mix together corn syrup, sugar, melted butter, and salt in a large bowl. Add eggs and beat until well combined. Pour mixture into the pie crust and sprinkle pecans over top. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool to room temperature before serving. Deb C I Made It Print 493 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 523 Calories 27g Fat 71g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 523 % Daily Value * Total Fat 27g 34% Saturated Fat 8g 41% Cholesterol 90mg 30% Sodium 328mg 14% Total Carbohydrate 71g 26% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Total Sugars 38g Protein 5g 10% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 52mg 4% Iron 2mg 8% Potassium 135mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Kentucky Pecan Pie 01 of 42 Photo by  Deb C 02 of 42 Photo by  FeistyDate9553 02/23/2023 I’m 65 years old and have made many, many pecan pie recipes over the years. This recipe is hands down the BEST. People who said it’s too sweet need to make a fruit pie. Pecan pie is supposed to be sweet. This is recipe is perfect. 03 of 42 Photo by  E Dant Williams 08/08/2021 04 of 42 Photo by  Lynn Blankenship Smith 01/22/2021 05 of 42 Photo by  Tyler McCullough 11/26/2020 06 of 42 Photo by  Evelyn Cordero 02/01/2020 I would make it again 07 of 42 Photo by  Daniel G 01/07/2020 08 of 42 Photo by  JackieBird 12/28/2019 09 of 42 Photo by  Trish Jones Fairbanks 12/01/2019 I searched and searched until I found my mom’s recipe. It is perfect. name: Laurie Nanni
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Mix together corn syrup, sugar, melted butter, and salt in a large bowl. Add eggs and beat until well combined. Pour mixture into the pie crust and sprinkle pecans over top.;Bake in the preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes.;Remove from the oven and let cool to room temperature before serving. Deb C
